[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #289](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/289/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

Okay @nachocano, I did a pass and left a comment.
I have a question regarding the `EvaluatorToPartitionStrategy` classes:
The class `SingleDataCenterEvaluatorToPartitionStrategy` seems to be the `EvaluatorToPartitionStrategy` for users that use the deprecated API. There doesn't seem to be a way to use `SingleDataCenterEvaluatorToPartitionStrategy` without the deprecated API. Is this intentional? If not, I think we need to change the code so that users can pick which strategy to use.

Thanks for asking!

This has been a classic example of changing specifications... and I'd like to ask for one more. When changing version numbers for the maven release, _only_ the poms must be changed. I accomplished this by commenting out stuff in the script. But, it would make sense to add such an option. @dongjun-Lee is this possible? Thanks for bearing with me.

Once that gets in, we can merge. Then I'll change the cwiki entries to add how some of the steps can be made easy via the scripts.

I've done a pass.
Did a pass. The code looks fine, but I left some notes on the JIRA.

@jsjason The idea was that people started using the distributed setDistributedDataSet method.
The MultiDataCenterStrategy should work the same as the Single strategy if you pass that you can load partitions anywhere.
I see your point, and I think it would be good to "un-deprecate" the methods then. People will still be able to use the setInputPath. The Single strategy will be used, which has less overhead than the Multi one.
Will make the changes and let you know when it's ready for review again.
Thanks
@markusweimer Fixed, please have another pass. Thanks!
Looks good, I will merge.
This looks good, will merge

@jsjason I didn't re-trigger the build, but it seems that someone did and it passed
@dongjun-Lee I've updated the [release manager guide](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/REEF/Release+Manager+Guide). Please double-check the script instructions that I've added.

@dafrista Sorry, I made a mistake. I fixed the bug.
Thanks a lot for the guide. In the guide, Step 3 might be included in step 4 because `release.py` includes removing "-SNAPSHOT" and changing versions in all files.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #395](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/395/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@dongjun-Lee thanks for the update! It looks good.

Can we remove the use of `change_version` in `release`?

I'm probably contradicting an earlier request. However, I now think this amount of automation is dangerous. The release manager should tarball the exact changes he made on the branch.

After this final change, I'm happy to merge.
